alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Chaves County Plains; Chuska Mountains; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Eastern San Miguel County; Estancia Valley; Far Northeast Highlands; Far Northwest Highlands; Guadalupe County; Harding County; Jemez Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 4:02PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RAIN AND SNOW WITH AREAS OF FOG TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY... Rain and snow will become widespread tonight as a storm system crosses from the west, then precipitation will linger into Wednesday mainly over the mountains and east. The snow level will drop as low as 6500 feet in elevation by sunrise Wednesday with a few to 4 additional inches of snow in the mountains mainly above 8500 feet, except for little or no accumulation in the mountains near the Colorado border. Further, areas of dense fog are forecast late tonight through Wednesday morning across west central and southwest areas, and across much of the area east of the central mountain chain. The visibility will probably drop below a half mile at times in precipitation and/or fog, and below a quarter mile across parts of the eastern plains. Travelers should anticipate wet roads with periods of significantly reduced visibility at lower elevations, as well as snow packed and icy roads through the mountains. Allow extra travel time to reach your destinations. Monitor road conditions at NMROADS.COM or via telephone at 1-800-432-4269 or by dialing 5-1-1 in New Mexico.
